channel.title: Good fighting styles?
channel.description:
Ok, ive got time and money to burn.
Whats a useful fighting style to learn?
Ive done some form of karate for a while but i just cannot for the life of me see a use for it in a fight unless you happen to have the reflexes of a cat and can pick the correct throw or grip out of the hundreds you have learnt. And then hope that you do it 100% right or get thrown on your ass.
No, i want a real fighting style.

item.title: Good fighting styles?
item.dc:creator: @Original_Daniel Original Daniel
item.description:
@Original_Daniel wrote:

[quote=“Sensored3, post:19, topic:257147”]Aikido is pretty damn effective against /anything/ because of the way it works. Its fuck hard to master, but the founder of it could dodge bullets.
I’m not shitting you.[/quote]
This. I used to do Aikido, it’s really powerful but hard to learn. I saw the teacher in action a few times and he was godly, but apparently nothing compared to the japanese masters.

I’d go with Aikido, or start with boxing to get fitness etc up and move onto kick boxing or something.

Read full topic

item.title: Good fighting styles?
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“OnlyOneRule, post:1, topic:257563”][quote author=Yz85Racer link=topic=339528.msg2635121#msg2635121 date=1232467522]

Judo, Jiu jistu. I do both. Kick boxing is good aswell.

Jiu jitsu training is tough. But you can learn how to disable someones gun or knife within a few weeks. I haven’t been doing it that long, but I’m going to do the test to get my orange belt soon.

What stripe? Green belt 4th stripe at the moment for me.
[/quote]
My school doesn’t use the stripe system. I don’t enter into tournaments or anything. I do it more as a sort of hobby to be part of the club if you know what I mean. I don’t think we do the belt system right either. I read somewhere, can’t remember where, that after white comes blue once you are older than 16, meaning you can’t have a green once you’re older than 16, but yet most of the men that go there (around 30-40 years old) have orange and green belts.

How long have you been doing it to have a green belt?[/quote]
About 3-4 years now.

Read full topic

item.title: Good fighting styles?
item.dc:creator: @PKERZ PKERZ
item.description:
@PKERZ wrote:

You could always learn Combat Ju-Jitsu. It is more or less only used for self-defence and fighting-style, and not as a sport. Also, it is a combination between 7 different fighting-sports, including Aikido, Karate, Judo, Ju-Jitsu and a few others. However, I am not so sure how broadened this is in the whole world - but you could always check it out.

Otherwise, I guess there is the Israeli combat-system developed for the military, called Krav Maga.

Read full topic

item.title: Good fighting styles?

item.description:
@BlazezFire wrote:

Sounds good I should learn that.

item.title: Good fighting styles?
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

Judo could be a good way to learn how to defend yourself, Muay Thai would be how to snap the shit out of someones legs with extremely powerful kicks that can kill, Jiu-jitsu would be good if you want to learn to fight older/bigger people, as the ground puts everyone on the same level.

Read full topic

go pump some iron
[/quote]
i do that already
and i still have yet to unlock the hidden fighting ability[/quote]
just be a street fighter, best style. If you’re in a fight and get into your karate stance seriously you will look like a fool. Or you could go boxing, i went there and its pretty good especially sparing that was fun.
